content.description: The graph shows the net force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi></math>, in newtons, exerted on an object as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi></math>, in seconds.
content.question: A <math alttext="1 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> object initially at rest experiences the net force shown in the graph. Which graph best represents the momentum <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>p</mi></math> of the object as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t”. The vertical axis is labeled “p”. The line begins at the origin and it curves slightly up and to the right through the plane ending high above the end of the horizontal axis and to the right of the top of the vertical axis. The curve has a slope that is zero at the origin and becomes increasingly steeper.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t”. The vertical axis is labeled “p”. The curve begins near the top, and slightly to the right, of the vertical axis and curves downward and to the right, very steeply at first and then more gradually until it becomes nearly horizontal as it approaches the horizontal axis. The curve ends slightly above the end of the horizontal axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t”. The vertical axis is labeled “p”. The curve begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually, and ends high above the end of the horizontal axis and to the right of the top of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t”. The vertical axis is labeled “p”. The line begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves to the right horizontally through the plane.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane with origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t”. The vertical axis is labeled “p”. The line begins at the origin and it curves slightly up and to the right through the plane ending high above the end of the horizontal axis and to the right of the top of the vertical axis. The curve has a slope that is zero at the origin and becomes increasingly steeper.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
